src: Tempulli i Artemisës në Efes u shkatërrua më 21 korrik 356 p.e.s. nga një zjarr i vënë nga Herostratusi. Motivimi i tij, sipas historisë, ishte fama me çdo kusht. Të zemëruar, efesianët bënë të ditur se emri i Herostratit nuk do të shënohej asnjëherë. Emri i tij u shënua më vonë nga historiani grek Strabo dhe kjo është mënyra si ka ardhur në ditët e sotme. Tempulli u shkatërrua në të njëjtën natë kur lindi Aleksandri i Madh. Si mbret, Aleksandri ofroi që të paguante për rindërtimin e tempullit, por propozimi tij nuk u pranua. Më vonë, pas vdekjes së Aleksandrit në vitin 323 p.e.s tempulli u rindërtua.
mt: 21 July 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed by fire set by Herostratus. His motive, according to history, was fame at any cost. The Ephesians were angered, and made it known that the name of Herostratus would never be remembered. The name of Herostratus was later recorded by the Greek historian Strabo, and this is how it came to be known in modern times. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. As king, Alexander offered to pay for the rebuilding of the temple, but his proposal was not accepted. Later, after the death of Alexander in 323 BC, the temple was rebuilt.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Mjeti i parë i njohur i transportit ishte ecja; njerëzit nisën të ecnin me këmbë dy milionë vite më parë kur u shfaq Homo Erectus (që do të thotë njeri në këmbë). Paraardhësit e tyre, australopithekusi, nuk ecnin në këmbë zakonisht. Përshtatjet për ecjen me dy këmbë janë gjetur te fosilet e australopitekut nga 4,2-3,9 milionë vite më parë, megjithëse sahelantropusi mund të ketë ecur me dy këmbë që shtatë milionë vite më parë.

src: Përdorimi i anijeve për transportin e mallrave është aktualisht mënyra më efikase për lëvizjen e sasive të mëdha të mallrave dhe njerëzve përtej oqeanit. Detyra e flotave detare ka qenë tradicionalisht që të sigurojë që vendi juaj të ruajë aftësinë për lëvizjen e njerëzve dhe mallrave, ndërkohë që, në të njëjtën kohë, ndërhyn në aftësinë e armiqve për lëvizjen e njerëzve dhe mallrave të tyre. Një prej shembujve të fundit më të rëndësishëm të kësaj ishte fushata e Atlantikut të Veriut në Luftën e Dytë Botërore. Amerikanët po tentonin të zhvendosnin njerëz dhe materiale përtej oqeanit Atlantik për t'i ardhur në ndihmë Britanisë. Njëkohësisht, flota gjermane po përpiqej të ndalonte trafikun duke përdorur kryesisht nëndetëset. Nëse Aleatët do të kishin dështuar, Gjermania ndoshta do të arrinte ta pushtonte Britaninë, ashtu si kishte ndodhur me vendet e tjera të Evropës.
mt: The use of ships for the transport of goods is currently the most effective way to move large quantities of goods and people across the ocean. The task of the navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with the ability of enemies to move their people and goods. One of the most recent examples of this was the Battle of the Atlantic in World War II. Americans were trying to move people and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to come to the aid of Britain. At the same time, the German navy was trying to stop traffic using mainly submarines. If the Allies had failed, Germany might have succeeded in conquering Britain, just as it had done with other countries in Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

mt: The use of ships for the transport of goods is currently the most effective way to move large quantities of goods and people across the ocean. The task of the navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with the ability of enemies to move their people and goods. One of the most recent examples of this was the Battle of the Atlantic in World War II. Americans were trying to move people and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to come to the aid of Britain. At the same time, the German navy was trying to stop traffic using mainly submarines. If the Allies had failed, Germany might have succeeded in conquering Britain, just as it had done with other countries in Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Shpikja e rrotave me rreze i bëri qerret asiriane më të lehta, më të shpejta e më të përgatitura për t'ia kaluar ushtarëve e qerreve të tjera. Shigjetat prej harqeve të tyre vdekjeprurëse mund të përshkojnë blindat e ushtarëve kundërshtarë. Rreth vitit 1000 p.e.s., asirianët shpikën kalorësinë e parë. Kavaleria është një togë ushtarake që lufton hipur në kalë. Meqenëse shala nuk ishte shpikur ende, kavaleria asiriane luftonte mbi kurrizet e zhveshura të kuajve të tyre.
mt: 1000 BC, Assyrians invented the first cavalry. Cavalry is a military unit that fights mounted on horseback. Since the saddle had not yet been invented, Assyrian cavalry fought bareback on their horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babilonasit ndërtuan për secilin prej zotave të tyre një tempull kryesor që quhej shtëpia e zotit. Populli u sillte zotave fli dhe priftërinjtë përpiqeshin të kujdeseshin për nevojat e zotave nëpërmjet kremtimeve e festave. Çdo tempull kishte një oborr tempulli të hapur e pastaj një faltore të brendshme ku kishin mundësi të hynin vetëm priftërinjtë. Ndonjëherë si pjesë përbërëse e tempujve ndërtoheshin kulla të posaçme në formë piramide, të quajtura zigurate. Maja e kullës ishte faltore e veçantë për zotin.
mt: The Babylonians built a main temple for each of their gods, which was called the house of the god. The people brought the gods sacrifices and the priests tried to take care of the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary where only the priests could enter. Sometimes as part of the temples pyramids were built in the form of ziggurats. The top of the pyramid was a special sanctuary for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Po! Mbreti Tutankhamun, i përmendur edhe si ""Mbreti Tut"" ose ""Djali mbret"", është një ndër mbretërit egjiptianë të lashtësisë më të njohur në kohërat moderne. Interesante është se ai nuk konsiderohej si shumë i rëndësishëm në kohët e lashta dhe nuk përmendej në pjesën më të madhe të listave të mbretërve të lashtë. Megjithatë, ai u bë i njohur nga zbulimi i varrit të tij në vitin 1922. Ndërkohë që shumë varre të vjetra ishin plaçkitur, ky varr ishte lënë pothuajse i patrazuar. Pjesa më e madhe e artikujve të varrosur me Tutankamunin janë ruajtur mirë, përfshi mijëra artefaktet e prodhuara nga metale të çmuara dhe gurë të rrallë."
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, also known as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian pharaohs in modern times. It is interesting that he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not mentioned in most lists of pharaohs. However, he became famous from the discovery of his tomb in 1922. While many old tombs had been plundered, this tomb was almost untouched. Most of the articles buried with Tutankhamun are well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made from precious metals and rare stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: "Ne njohim shumë politikanë, shkencëtarë e artistë grekë. Personazhi më i njohur i kësaj kulture është ndoshta Homeri, poeti i verbër legjendar, i cili krijoi dy kryeveprat e letërsisë greke: poemat ""Iliada"" dhe ""Odiseja"". Sofokliu dhe Aristofani janë përsëri dramaturgë të preferuar dhe veprat e tyre konsiderohen si ndër veprat më të shkëlqyera të letërsisë botërore. Një tjetër grek i mirënjohur është një matematikan, Pitagora, që njihet në përgjithësi për teoremën e tij të famshme rreth marrëdhënieve të brinjëve të trekëndëshave kënddrejtë."
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. The most famous character of this culture is probably Homer, the legendary blind poet, who created the two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems "Iliad" and "Odyssey". Sophocles and Aristophanes are again preferred dramatists and their works are considered as among the most brilliant works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician, Pythagoras, who is known in general for his famous theorem about the relationships of the sides of right triangles.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Banesa nuk kishte dhe aq rëndësi në klimën e ngrohtë të Lindjes së Mesme. Jeta në familjen hebraike ndodhte kryesisht në ajër të hapur. Gratë i bënin gjellët në oborr; dyqanet ishin thjesht sportele të hapura me pamje nga rruga. Për të ndërtuar banesat përdorej guri. Në tokën e Kananit nuk kishte pyje të mëdha, prandaj lënda e drurit ishte jashtëzakonisht e shtrenjtë.
mt: The house had no importance in the warm climate of the Middle East. Life in the Hebrew family took place mostly in the open air. Women made the stew in the courtyard; shops were simply open stalls with a view of the street. For building houses, stone was used. In the land of Canaan there were no large trees, so wood was extraordinarily expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: "Groenlanda kishte pak vendbanime. Në sagat skandinave, thuhet se Eriku i Kuq u dëbua nga Islanda për vrasje dhe, në udhëtimet e tij drejt perëndimit, ai zbuloi Groelandën dhe i vendosi emrin Groenlandë. Megjithatë, fiset eskimeze jetonin tanimë atje në atë periudhë pavarësisht nga zbulimi i tij. Ndonëse çdo shtet ishte ""skandinav"", midis njerëzve, mbretërve, zakoneve e historisë së Danimarkës, Suedisë, Norvegjisë e Islandës kishte mjaft dallime."
mt: "Greenland had few settlements. In the sagas, Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder and, on his westward voyages, he discovered Greenland and named it Greenland. However, the Inuit had already been living there at the time of his discovery. Despite being "Scandinavian", between people, kings, customs and the history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland there were many differences."
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Ndonëse do ta njihnim pjesën më të madhe të ushqimeve të tyre, romakët kishin mjaft artikuj të çuditshëm ose të pazakontë për festa, përfshi derrin e egër, palloin, kërmijtë dhe një lloj brejtësi të quajtur gjer. Një dallim tjetër ishte se, ndërkohë që njerëzit e varfër dhe gratë e hanin ushqimin e tyre të ulur në karrige, burrat e pasur pëlqenin të hanin bashkë në gosti, ku i hanin vaktet e tyre të shtrirë në ije. Vaktet e romakëve të lashtë nuk mund të kenë përfshirë ushqime që erdhën nga Amerika ose Azia në Evropë gjatë shekujve të mëvonshëm. Ata, për shembull, nuk kishin as misër, as domate, as patate, as kakao e madje nuk ka romak të lashtë që të ketë shijuar ndonjëherë gjel deti.
mt: Although we will recognize most of their food, the Romans had some very strange or unusual items for feasts, including wild boar, peacocks, locusts and a type of bird called a gier. Another difference was that, while the poor and women ate their food sitting on a bench, the rich preferred to eat together at a banquet, where they ate their meals spread out on a table. The feasts of the ancient Romans could not have included foods that came from America or Asia to Europe during the following centuries. They, for example, did not have wheat, tomatoes, potatoes, cocoa and there is no ancient Roman who has ever tasted sea jelly.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: "Civilizim quhet një kulturë e veçantë dhe e përbashkët e një grupi mjaft të madh njerëzish që jetojnë e punojnë në bashkëpunim, një shoqëri. Fjala ""qytetërim"" e ka prejardhjen nga fjala latine ""civilis"" që do të thotë ""civil"", e cila lidhet me fjalën latine ""civis"" që do të thotë ""qytetar"" dhe ""civitas"" që do të thotë ""qytet"" ose ""qytet-shtet"", që në një farë forme përcakton edhe madhësinë e shoqërisë. Qytet-shtetet janë pararendësit e shteteve. Një kulturë qytetëruese nënkupton transmetimin e njohurive nëpër disa gjenerata, një gjurmë të vijueshme kulturore dhe një përhapje të drejtë. Kulturat më të vogla shpesh zhduken pa lënë dëshmi përkatëse historike dhe s'arrijnë të njihen si civilizime të mirëfillta."
mt: "Civilization is a particular and common culture of a large group of people who live and work together, a society. The word ""civilization"" has its origin in the Latin word ""civilis"" which means ""civil"", which is related to the Latin word ""civis"" which means ""citizen"" and ""civitas"" which means ""city"" or ""city-state"", which in some form defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of states. A city culture implies the transmission of knowledge across generations, a traceable cultural trail and a fair spread. Smaller cultures often disappear without leaving historical evidence and are not recognized as proper civilizations."
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

Smaller cultures often disappear without leaving historical evidence and are not recognized as proper civilizations."
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong është një fortesë e rrënuar dhe manastir budist në pjesën e sipërme të rrethit të Paros (në fshatin Fondei). Siç thuhet, në vitin 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel e ndërtoi këtë fortesë në kujtim të fitores së tij kundër forcave tibetiano-mongole. Në 1951, një zjarr bëri që të mbeteshin vetëm disa relikte nga Drukgyal Dzong, si p.sh. imazhi i Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Kalaja u ruajt dhe u mbrojt pas zjarrit, duke vazhduar të jetë një prej aktiviteteve kulturore më të famshme të Butanit.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro valley (in the village of Fondei). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal built this fortress in commemoration of his victory over the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire left only a few relics from Drukgyal Dzong, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. The fortress was preserved and protected after the fire, continuing to be one of the most famous cultural activities of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Në shekullin e 18-të, Kamboxhia e gjeti veten të shtypur mes dy fqinjëve të saj të fuqishëm, Tajlandës dhe Vietnamit. Tajlandezët e pushtuan disa herë Kamboxhën në shekullin e 18-të dhe në vitin 1772, ata prishën Pnom-Penin. Vitet e fundit të shekullit të 18-të, Kamboxhën e pushtuan edhe vietnamezët.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia found itself between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772, they destroyed Pnom-Pen. The last years of the 18th century, Cambodia was also invaded by the Vietnamese.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: "Zanafilla e Tajvanit nis kohë më parë, në shekullin e 15-të, kur marinarët evropianë që kaluan andej e regjistruan emrin e ishullit si ""Ilha Formosa"" ose ""ishulli i bukur"". Shoqëria Holandeze e Indisë Lindore themelon në vitin 1624 një bazë në Tajvanin Jugperëndimor, duke nisur një shndërrim të praktikave të prodhimit të drithërave vendëse dhe duke punësuar punëtorë kinezë në plantacionet e saj të orizit e sheqerit. Në vitin 1683, forcat e dinastisë Qing (1644-1912) morën në kontroll zonat bregdetare në perëndim dhe veri të Tajvanit dhe e shpallën Tajvanin provincë të Perandorisë Qing në vitin 1885. Në vitin 1895, pas disfatës në Luftën e Parë Kino-Japoneze (1894-1895), qeveria e dinastisë Qing nënshkroi Traktatin e Shimonosekit, sipas të cilit i dha sovranitetin e Tajvanit Japonisë, e cila e udhëhoqi deri në vitin 1945."
mt: The origins of Taiwan begin earlier, in the 15th century, when European mariners who passed by it recorded its name as "Ilha Formosa" or "beautiful island". The Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan in 1624, starting a shift in local rice and sugar production practices and hiring Chinese laborers for its plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces took control of coastal areas in the west and north of Taiwan and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded sovereignty of Taiwan to Japan, which led it until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Kjo quhet pH-ja e një kimikati. Mund të përgatitni një tregues me anë të lëngut të lakrës së kuqe. Lëngu i lakrës e ndryshon ngjyrën në varësi të nivelit acidik ose bazik (alkalin) të kimikatit. Niveli i pH-së dëshmohet nga sasia e joneve të hidrogjenit (H-ja te pH-ja) në kimikatin e analizuar. Jonet e hidrogjenit janë protone që u janë hequr elektronet (pasi atomet e hidrogjenit përbëhen nga një elektron dhe një proton).
mt: This is called the pH of a solution. You can make a pH indicator by mixing red ink. The ink changes color in response to the acidity or alkalinity (basicity) of the solution. The pH level of a solution is indicated by the number of hydrogen ions (H- in the pH) in the solution. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had electrons removed (since hydrogen atoms consist of one electron and one proton).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Luanët janë felinët më shoqërorë. Ata jetojnë në grupe të mëdha të quajtura tufa. Tufat përbëhen nga një deri në tre meshkuj të afërm të rritur, bashkë me deri në tridhjetë femra e këlyshë. Femrat, duke qenë pjesë e një familjeje të madhe motrash dhe bijash, kanë në përgjithësi lidhje më të afërta me njëra-tjetrën. Tufat e luanëve sillen si kope ujqërish ose qensh, kafshë me sjellje që ngjan çuditërisht me atë të luanëve (por jo me të maceve të tjera të mëdha) dhe po ashtu shumë vdekjeprurëse për prenë e tyre.
mt: Lions are the most social of the big cats. They live in large groups called prides. A pride consists of one to three adult males, along with up to 30 females and their young. Females, who are part of a large family of sisters and daughters, have in general closer ties with one another. Lion prides move like herds of wolves or dogs, animals with a behavior that strangely resembles that of lions (but not other large cats) and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Poshtë tyre janë macet më të mëdha se mesataret që ushqehen me pre të madhësisë mesatare, duke filluar nga lepujt e deri tek antilopat dhe dreri. Si përfundim, ka shumë mace të vogla (duke përfshirë macet shtëpiake që lëvizin lirshëm) që hanë shumë më shumë kafshë të vogla si insektet, brejtësit, hardhucat e zogjtë. Sekreti i suksesit të tyre është koncepti i qoshes së rehatshme, një funksion i veçantë që ka çdo mace që nuk e lejon atë të konkurrojë me të tjerat.
mt: Below them are larger-than-average cats that feed on large prey, ranging from mice to antelopes and deer. There are many small cats (including domestic cats that roam freely) that eat much more small prey such as insects, rodents, and birds. Their secret to success is the concept of the comfortable couch, a unique function that every cat does not allow it to compete with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Oçelotët pëlqejnë të ushqehen me kafshë të vogla. Kur munden, kapin majmunë, gjarpërinj, brejtës e shpendë. Thuajse të gjitha kafshët që gjuan oceloti janë në përmasa shumë më të vogla se ai. Shkencëtarët mendojnë se okelotët i ndjekin dhe i gjejnë kafshët (prenë e tyre) nëpërmjet erës, duke nuhatur se ku kanë qenë në tokë. Ata mund të shikojnë shumë mirë në errësirë me shikimin e tyre të natës dhe lëvizin shumë vjedhurazi po ashtu. Okelotët e gjuajnë prenë e tyre duke u përzier me ambientin rrethues dhe duke u hedhur më pas mbi prenë e tyre.
mt: Ocelots prefer to feed on small animals. When they can, they catch monkeys, snakes, deer and birds. Almost all the animals that ocelots hunt are much smaller than they are. Scientists believe that ocelots track and find animals (their prey) by smell, indicating where they have been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with their night vision and move stealthily as well. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending into the surrounding environment and then pouncing on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Si një atlet mjaft i përgatitur, një tigër mund të ngjitet (megjithëse jo aq mirë), të notojë, të kërcejë në distanca të mëdha dhe të tërheqë me forcën e pesë njerëzve të fuqishëm. Tigri është në një grup (gjinia panterë) me luanët, leopardët e jaguarët. Këto janë katër macet e vetme të cilat mund të vrumbullijnë. Ulërima e tigrit s'është si ulërima me zë të plotë e një luani, por është më shumë si një fjali me fjalë me hungërima e të bërtitura.
mt: As a well-trained athlete, a tiger can climb (although not as well), swim, leap great distances and pull with the strength of five strong men. The tiger is in a group (genus Panthera) with lions, leopards and jaguars. These are the only four cats that can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-throated roar of a lion, but is more like a growl with words and barks.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: "Qeliza është njësia më e vogël strukturore e funksionale në një organizëm të gjallë (gjallesat). ""Qelizë"" vjen nga fjala latine ""cella"" që do të thotë ""dhomë e vogël"". Nëse shihni gjallesat në mikroskop, do të vini re se përbëhen nga katrorë ose topa të vegjël. Robert Huku, një biolog nga Anglia, pa me mikroskop katrorë të vegjël në tapë. Ato i përngjanin dhomave. Ai ishte njeriu i parë që vëzhgoi qelizat e vdekura."
mt: "A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living organism (living things). The word "cell" comes from the Latin word "cella" which means "small room". If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw small squares under a microscope on a piece of paper. They looked like small rooms. He was the first person to see dead cells."
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: "Qeliza është njësia më e vogël strukturore e funksionale në një organizëm të gjallë (gjallesat). ""Qelizë"" vjen nga fjala latine ""cella"" që do të thotë ""dhomë e vogël"". Nëse shihni gjallesat në mikroskop, do të vini re se përbëhen nga katrorë ose topa të vegjël. Robert Huku, një biolog nga Anglia, pa me mikroskop katrorë të vegjël në tapë. Ato i përngjanin dhomave. Ai ishte njeriu i parë që vëzhgoi qelizat e vdekura."
mt: "A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living organism (living things). The word "cell" comes from the Latin word "cella" which means "small room". If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw small squares under a microscope on a piece of paper. They looked like small rooms. He was the first person to see dead cells."
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Kafshët janë krijuar nga shumë qeliza. Ato hanë gjëra e i tresin në brendësi. Pjesa më e madhe e kafshëve mund të lëvizin. Vetëm kafshët kanë tru (ndonëse jo të gjitha kafshët kanë; për shembull, kandilat e detit nuk kanë tru). Kafshët ndodhen kudo në tokë. Ata gërmojnë tokën, notojnë në oqeane dhe fluturojnë në qiell.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (although not all animals have; for example, sea cucumbers do not have brains). Animals are found everywhere on Earth. They dig in the ground, swim in oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Bimët prodhojnë oksigjenin që thithin njerëzit dhe thithin dyoksidin e karbonit që nxjerrin njerëzit (domethënë, që nxjerrin me anë të frymëmarrjes). Bimët e prodhojnë ushqimin e tyre nga dielli nëpërmjet fotosintezës. Ato bëjnë edhe hije. Ne i ndërtojmë shtëpitë me bimët dhe i krijojmë veshjet me bimët. Pjesa më e madhe e ushqimeve që ne hamë vijnë nga bimët. Pa bimët, kafshët nuk do të mund të mbijetonin.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that people breathe in and carbon dioxide that people exhale (that is, that they exhale through breathing). Plants produce their food from the sun through photosynthesis. They also make shade. We build our houses with plants and make our clothes with plants. Most of the food that we eat comes from plants. Without plants, animals would not be able to survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Kur një grup i vogël gjallesash (një popullatë e vogël) ndahet nga popullata kryesore nga e cila kanë ardhur (si p.sh. nëse kalojnë një vargmal ose lumë, ose nëse shkojnë në një ishull të ri që kështu nuk mund të kthehen prapa me lehtësi), shpesh do ta gjejnë veten në një ambient të ndryshëm nga ai ku kanë qenë më parë. Ky mjedis i ri ka burime të ndryshme dhe konkurrentë të ndryshëm, prandaj popullatës së re do t'i duhen karakteristika ose përshtatje të ndryshme që të jetë një konkurrent më i fortë sesa një konkurrent i nevojshëm më parë. Popullata origjinale nuk ka ndryshuar fare, ajo ka ende nevojë për të njëjtat përshtatje si më parë. Me kalimin e kohës, me fillimin e përshtatjes së popullatës së re në mjedisin e saj të ri, ajo fillon të duket gjithmonë e më pak e ngjashme me popullatën tjetër. Në fund, pas mijëra ose madje miliona vjetësh, dy popullatat do të duken aq ndryshe, saqë nuk do të mund të konsiderohen i njëjti lloj. Ky proces quhet speciacion, që nënkupton thjesht krijimin e specieve të reja. Speciacioni është pjesë shumë e rëndësishme dhe pasojë e pashmangshme e evolucionit.
mt: When a small group of animals (a small population) separates from the main population from which they came (e.g. if they cross a mountain range or river, or if they go to a new island that they cannot easily return from), they often find themselves in a different environment from the one they were in before. This new environment has different resources and competitors, so the new population will need different characteristics or adaptations to be a stronger competitor than a previous competitor. The original population has not changed at all, it still needs the same adaptations as before. Over time, with the beginning of the adaptation of the new population to its new environment, it begins to look more and more different from the other population. In the end, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they cannot be considered the same type. This process is called speciation, which simply means the creation of new species. Speciation is a very important and inevitable consequence of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Organi kryesor në sistemin e qarkullimit të gjakut është zemra, që kryen pompimin e gjakut. Gjaku del nga zemra nëpërmjet gypave që quhen arterie dhe hyn përsëri në zemër nëpërmjet gypave që quhen vena. Gypat më të vegjël quhen kapilarë.
mt: The main organ in the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart through vessels called arteries and returns to the heart through vessels called veins. Smaller vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Organi kryesor në sistemin e qarkullimit të gjakut është zemra, që kryen pompimin e gjakut. Gjaku del nga zemra nëpërmjet gypave që quhen arterie dhe hyn përsëri në zemër nëpërmjet gypave që quhen vena. Gypat më të vegjël quhen kapilarë.

src: Te kafshët, insektet ishin të parat që u ngritën në ajër. Aftësia e fluturimit i ndihmoi ato të evitonin me më shumë lehtësi grabitqarët e tyre dhe të gjenin ushqim e të çiftoheshin me më shumë efikasitet. Pjesa më e madhe e insekteve kanë përparësinë që mund t'i palosin krahët e tyre mbrapa në gjatësinë e trupit. Kjo u jep atyre një numër më të madh vendesh të vogla ku të struken prej grabitqarëve. Të vetmet insekte sot që nuk mund t'i palosin krahët prapa janë pilivesat dhe fluturat e majit.
mt: Birds were the first to take to the air. The ability to fly helped them evade predators and find food and mate more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the length of their body. This gives them a greater number of small places to hide from predators. The only insects today that cannot fold their wings back are butterflies and moths.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Mjaft paleontologë mendojnë sot se një grup dinozaurësh mbijetuan dhe janë gjallë sot. Ne i quajmë zogj. Shumë njerëz nuk i shikojnë si dinozaurë, pasi ata janë me pendë si dhe mund të fluturojnë. Por ka shumë gjëra për sa i përket zogjve që janë të ngjashme me dinozaurët. Ata kanë këmbë me kthetra dhe luspa, bëjnë vezë dhe ecin me këmbët e pasme si një dinozaur T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that a group of dinosaurs survived and are still alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't see them as dinosaurs, because they have feathers and can fly. But there are many things about birds that are similar to dinosaurs. They have clawed feet and a beak, lay eggs and walk on their hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Mjaft paleontologë mendojnë sot se një grup dinozaurësh mbijetuan dhe janë gjallë sot. Ne i quajmë zogj. src: Me dhëmbët e tij, një triceratop mund të shtypte jo vetëm gjethet, por edhe degët e rrënjët shumë të forta. Disa shkencëtarë mendojnë se triceratopët hanin cikade që ishin një lloj bime e rëndomtë në Kretace. Këto bimë duken si pemë e vogël palme me kurorë gjethesh të mprehta me gjemba. Një triceratops mund ta ketë përdorur sqepin e tij të fuqishëm për heqjen e gjetheve para se të hante trungun. Shkencëtarë të tjerë ngrenë argumentin se këto bimë janë shumë helmuese, prandaj nuk ka shumë mundësi që të jenë ngrënë nga ndonjë lloj dinozauri, megjithëse sot përtaci (sloth: kafshë) dhe kafshë të tjera si papagalli (pasardhës i dinozaurëve) mund t'i hanë frutat ose gjethet helmuese.
mt: With its teeth, a triceratops could not only strip leaves, but also strong rootlets. Some scientists think that triceratops ate cicadas that were a common type of tree in the Cretaceous. These trees look like small palm trees with dense crowns of leaflets with knobs. A triceratops might have used its powerful beak to strip the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists raise the argument that these trees are very poisonous, so there is little chance that they were eaten by any kind of dinosaur, although today sloths (mammals) and other animals such as parrots (descendants of dinosaurs) can eat the fruit or poisonous leaves.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Ekipi kombëtar italian i futbollit, ashtu si ekipi kombëtar gjerman i futbollit, është ekipi i dytë më i suksesshëm në botë dhe, në vitin 2006, ishin kampionët e Kupës së Botës së FIFA-s. Sportet popullore përfshijnë futbollin, basketbollin, volejbollin, vaterpolon, skermën, ragbinë, çiklizmin, hokejin mbi akull, hokejin me patina me rrota dhe garat me makina F1. Sportet dimërore janë më shumë popullore në rajonet veriore, duke nisur me italianët që garojnë si në lojërat ndërkombëtare ashtu edhe në aktivitetet olimpike.
mt: The Italian national football team, as well as the German national football team, is the second most successful team in the world and, in 2006, were the FIFA World Cup champions. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, speed skating and Formula 1 racing. Winter sports are more popular in the northern regions, starting with Italians who compete in both international games and Olympic activities.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luksemburgu ka një histori të gjatë si shtet, por pavarësia e tij fillon nga viti 1839. Disa pjesë të Belgjikës së sotme kanë qenë pjesë e Luksemburgut më parë, por u bënë belge pas revolucionit belg të vitit 1830. Luksemburgu ka tentuar gjithnjë që të qëndrojë një vend asnjanës, por ai u pushtua nga Gjermania si në Luftën e Parë Botërore, ashtu dhe në Luftën e Dytë Botërore. Në vitin 1957, Luksemburgu u bë anëtar themelues i organizatës që sot njihet si Bashkimi Evropian.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history as a state, but its independence begins in 1839. Some parts of modern Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Luksemburgu ka një histori të gjatë si shtet, por pavarësia e tij fillon nga viti 1839. Disa pjesë të Belgjikës së sotme kanë qenë pjesë e Luksemburgut më parë, por u bënë belge pas revolucionit belg të vitit 1830. Luksemburgu ka tentuar gjithnjë që të qëndrojë një vend asnjanës, por ai u pushtua nga Gjermania si në Luftën e Parë Botërore, ashtu dhe në Luftën e Dytë Botërore. Në vitin 1957, Luksemburgu u bë anëtar themelues i organizatës që sot njihet si Bashkimi Evropian.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history as a state, but its independence begins in 1839. Some parts of modern Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Pjesa evropiane e Turqisë (Trakia lindore ose Rumelia në gadishullin e Ballkanit) përfshin 3% të vendit. Territori i Turqisë është më i madh se 1600 kilometra (1000 mi) i gjatë dhe 800 km (500 mi) i gjerë, me një formë gati drejtkëndëshe. Sipërfaqja e Turqisë, përfshirë liqenet, është 783 562 kilometra katrorë (300 948 milje katrorë), 755 688 kilometra katrorë (291 773 milje katrorë) prej të cilëve ndodhen në Azinë Jugperëndimore dhe 23 764 kilometra katrorë (9174 milje katrorë) në Evropë. Nga sipërfaqja, Turqia është shteti i 37-të më i madh në botë dhe madhësia e saj është afërsisht sa Franca metropolitane dhe Mbretëria e Bashkuar të marra së bashku. Turqia është e rrethuar nga të treja anët me dete: detin Egje në perëndim, Detin e Zi në veri dhe detin Mesdhe në jug.
mt: The European part of Turkey (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula) comprises 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is longer than 1600 kilometres (1000 mi) and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a shape almost rectangular. The area of Turkey, including lakes, is 783 562 square kilometres (300 948 sq mi), 755 688 square kilometres (291 773 sq mi) of which are in Southwest Asia and 23 764 square kilometres (9174 sq mi) in Europe. From the area, Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world and its size is about as France metropolitan and United Kingdom taken together. Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea in the west, the Black Sea in the north and the Mediterranean Sea in the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Popullsia e Vatikanit është afërsisht 800. Ai është shteti më i vogël i pavarur në botë dhe shteti me popullsi më të vogël. Qyteti i Vatikanit përdor gjuhën italiane në legjislacion dhe në komunikimet e tij zyrtare. Italishtja është po ashtu gjuha që përdoret çdo ditë nga pjesa më e madhe e atyre që punojnë në shtet, kurse latinishtja përdoret shpeshherë në ceremonitë fetare. Të gjithë shtetasit e Qytetit të Vatikanit janë katolikë romanë.
mt: The population of Vatican City is about 800. It is the smallest independent state in the world and the state with the smallest population. The city of Vatican uses Italian in its legislation and in its official communications. Italian is also the language used every day by the majority of those who work in the state, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of the City of Vatican are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Në ditët e sotme, kompjuterët shfrytëzohen për manipulimin e fotografive dhe videove. Nëpërmjet kompjuterave mund të ndërtohen animacione të sofistikuara, të cilat po gjejnë gjithnjë e më shumë përdorim në televizion dhe në filma. Muzika regjistrohet shpesh duke përdorur kompjuterë të sofistikuar për përpunimin dhe përzierjen e përbashkët të tingujve.
mt: Today, computers are used to manipulate photographs and videos. Through computers, sophisticated animations can be built, which are finding more and more use in television and movies. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers for processing and mixing of sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Qytetet e Harapasë dhe Mohenjo-daros kishin tualet me shkarkim gati në çdo banesë, të lidhur me një sistem ujërash të zeza mjaft të ndërlikuar. Në shtëpitë e qyteteve minoane të Kretës dhe Santorinit në Greqi janë gjetur mbetje të sistemeve të ujërave të zeza. Tualetet ekzistonin edhe në Egjiptin, Persinë dhe Kinën e lashtë. Tualetet, në qytetërimin romak, ishin nganjëherë pjesë e banjave publike të përziera për burrat dhe gratë.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had toilets almost in every house, connected to a complex enough sewer system. In the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece, remains of sewer systems have been found. Toilets existed in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman era, toilets were sometimes part of public baths for men and women.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Tehu në patinat moderne ka dy buzë me një zgavër të lugët midis tyre. Dy buzët lejojnë një kapje më të mirë të akullit, edhe kur anohet. Për arsye se pjesa e poshtme e tehut është paksa e përkulur, edhe buza që bie në kontakt me akullin përkulet kur tehu anohet në njërën apo në tjetrën anë. Kjo shkakton kthimin e patinatorit. Nëse patinat pirren nga e djathta, patinatori kthehet djathtas, nëse patinat pirren nga e majta, patinatori kthehet majtas.
mt: The modern skates have two blades with a groove between them. The two blades allow a better grip of the ice, even when skating. Because the bottom of the skate is slightly tilted, even the blade that comes in contact with the ice tilts when the skate is turned to one side or the other. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates are turned to the right, the skater turns to the right, if the skates are turned to the left, the skater turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Për t'u kthyer te niveli i tyre i mëparshëm i energjisë, ata duhet të çlirohen nga energjia shtesë që morën nga drita. Ata e realizojnë këtë me anë të lëshimit të një grimce të vogël drite që quhet ""foton"". Shkencëtarët e quajnë këtë proces ""emetimi i nxitur i rrezatimit"" pasi atomet nxiten nga drita e fortë duke sjellë emetimin e një fotoni drite dhe drita është një lloj rrezatimi. Në fotografinë tjetër shfaqen atomet duke lëshuar fotone. Sigurisht, në realitet, fotonet janë shumë më të vogla se në fotografi. Fotonet janë edhe më të vegjël se elementet nga të cilat përbëhen atomet!"
mt: "To return to their original energy level, they must be freed from the extra energy they gained from the light. They accomplish this by emitting a small flash of light called a "photon." Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because atoms are stimulated by strong light to emit a photon of light and light is a form of radiation. In the other photograph, the atoms are shown emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than in the photograph. Photons are even smaller than the elements from which atoms are made!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Pas qindra orëve punë, filamenti i llambës më në fund do të digjet dhe ajo nuk do të punojë më. Llamba duhet të zëvendësohet më pas. Duhet të jeni të kujdesshëm kur të zëvendësoni llambën. Së pari, duhet të fiket çelësi i dritës ose duhet të shkëputet kablloja. Kjo ndodh sepse energjia elektrike që kalon në portollambë ku qëndron pjesa metalike e llambës mund të japë një goditje të rëndë elektrike në rast se prekni pjesën e brendshme të portollambës ose fundin metalik të llambës kur ajo është akoma pjesërisht në portollambë.
mt: After hundreds of hours of use, the filament finally burns out and the lamp will no longer work. The lamp will need to be replaced later. Be careful when replacing the lamp. First, the light switch should be turned off or the power cord should be unplugged. This is because the electrical energy that passes through the lamp socket where the metal part of the lamp sits can give a strong electrical shock if you touch the internal part of the lamp socket or the metal end of the lamp while it is still partially in the lamp socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bomba atomike funksionon mbi parimin se bashkimi i disa protoneve dhe neutroneve me një bërthamë kërkonë energji. Njëlloj si të ngjitësh një karrocë të rëndë lart në kodër. Ndarja e bërthamës nga e para, çliron një pjesë të asaj energjie. Disa atome kanë bërthama të paqëndrueshme që nënkupton se ato kanë tendencë të ndahen vetvetiu ose me një ngacmim sado të vogël.
mt: The atomic bomb works on the principle that the fusion of several protons and neutrons with a core requires energy. Just like lifting a heavy cart up a hill. The separation of the core from the first, releases a part of that energy. Some atoms have unstable cores that means they have a tendency to split themselves or with a small stimulation.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Kur bëni një telefonatë me dikë mijëra milje larg jush, ju përdorni një satelit. Sateliti në hapësirë e merr thirrjen e më pas e kthen atë përsëri, thuajse në çast. Sateliti u dërgua në hapësirë me anë të një rakete. Shkencëtarët i përdorin teleskopët në hapësirë për arsye se atmosfera e Tokës e shtrembëron një pjesë të dritës dhe të pamjes sonë. Për vendosjen e një sateliti ose teleskopi në hapësirë, nevojitet një raketë gjigante me lartësi mbi 100 këmbë.
mt: When you make a phone call to someone thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite receives the call and then returns it back to you, almost instantaneously. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts some of our light and sight. To place a satellite or telescope in space, a giant rocket with a height of over 100 feet is needed.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Koha është diçka që ekziston përreth nesh dhe ka efekt në çdo gjë që bëjmë, e megjithatë kuptohet me vështirësi. Koha është studiuar prej mijëra vitesh nga studiuesit fetarë, filozofë e shkencorë. Ne e shikojmë kohën si një varg ngjarjesh që vazhdojnë nga e ardhmja, në të tashmen dhe në të kaluarën. Koha është po ashtu mënyra me të cilën krahasojmë kohëzgjatjen (zgjatjen) e ngjarjeve. Mund ta vrojtoni vetë kalimin e kohës me anë të vëzhgimit të përsëritjes së një ngjarjeje ciklike. Një ngjarje ciklike është diçka që ndodh rregullisht në mënyrë të përsëritur.
mt: Time is something that exists around us and has an effect on everything we do, but it is understood with difficulty. Time has been studied for thousands of years by religious scholars, philosophers and scientists. We see time as a series of events that continue from the future, to the present, and to the past. Time is also the way we compare the duration (length) of events. You can observe the passage of time by observing the repetition of a cyclic event. A cyclic event is something that happens regularly in a repeated manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Si traditë, trashëgimtari i fronit pas mbarimit të shkollës do të futej menjëherë në ushtri. Megjithatë, Çarlsi ndoqi universitetin në Kolegjin Trinity, Kembrixh, ku studioi antropologji dhe arkeologji, e më vonë histori, duke marrë një diplomë 2:2 (një diplomë më e ulët e nivelit të dytë). Çarlsi ishte i pari nga anëtarët e Familjes Mbretërore të Britanisë që mori diplomë.
mt: As tradition dictated, the heir to the throne would immediately enter the military upon leaving school. However, Charles followed university at Trinity College, Cambridge, where he studied anthropology and archaeology, and later history, receiving a 2:2 degree (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Anglia kishte kaluar një periudhë të gjatë në paqe pas ripushtimit të Danelaw-it. Megjithatë, Etelredi u përball në vitin 991 me një flotë vikinge më të madhe se çdo flotë tjetër që nga ajo e Guthrumit një shekull më parë. Kjo flotë udhëhiqej nga Olaf Trygvasson, një norvegjez me ambiciet për ta rifituar vendin e tij nga sundimi danez. Pas pengesave ushtarake të fillimit, Etelredi arriti të hyjë në marrëveshje me Olafin, i cili u kthye në Norvegji që të përpiqej të fitonte mbretërinë e tij me një sukses të përzier.
mt: England had enjoyed a long period of peace since the re-conquest of Danelaw. Nevertheless, Ethelred was faced in 991 with a larger Viking fleet than any since that of Guthrum a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to regain his homeland from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred managed to negotiate with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to win his kingdom with a mixed success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Rreth shekullit të 15-të, pjesa veriore e Estonisë ishte nën një ndikim të madh kulturor të Gjermanisë. Disa murgj gjermanë dëshironin ti afronin vendasit me Zotin, prandaj sajuan gjuhën letrare estoneze. Ajo u bazua në alfabetin gjerman dhe në të u shtua një shkronjë ""Õ/õ"". Me kalimin e kohës, shumë nga fjalët e huazuara nga gjuha gjermane u bashkuan. Ky ishte fillimi i iluminizmit."
mt: 15th century, the northern part of Estonia was under a great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring the locals to God, so they introduced the Estonian language. It was based on the German alphabet and added a letter ""Õ/õ"". Over time, many of the words borrowed from the German language were added. This was the beginning of the Enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Ka vlerësime të ndryshme për numrin e personave që flasin gjuhën hindisht. Ajo vlerësohet të jetë mes gjuhës së dytë dhe të katërt të gjuhëve më të folura në botë. Numri i folësve të gjuhës amtare ndryshon në varësi të faktit nëse llogariten apo jo dialektet mjaft të përafërta. Përllogaritjet shkojnë nga 340 milionë deri në 500 milionë folës dhe deri në 800 milionë persona mund ta kuptojnë gjuhën. Gjuhët hindisht dhe urduisht janë të ngjashme në aspektin e fjalorit, por të ndryshme në sistemin e shkrimit; në bisedat e përditshme, ata që i flasin këto gjuhëve zakonisht mund ta kuptojnë njëri-tjetrin.
mt: 340 million to 500 million people speak it as a first language and up to 800 million people can understand it. The Hindi and Urdu languages are similar in vocabulary, but different in writing system; in everyday conversations, those who speak these languages usually can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul është alfabeti i vetëm i krijuar qëllimisht për përdorim të gjerë të përditshëm. Alfabeti u krijua në vitin 1444 gjatë sundimit të mbretit Sejong (1418-1450). Mbreti Sejong ishte mbreti i katërt i Dinastisë Joseon dhe është një nga më të vlerësuarit. Ai e emërtoi në fillim alfabetin hangul ""Hunmin Jeongeum"", që do të thotë ""tingujt e saktë për udhëzimin e njerëzve""."
mt: "Hangeul is the only alphabet ever created specifically for widespread everyday use. The alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418-1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the alphabet "Hunmin Jeongeum", which means "correct sounds for the instruction of the people"."
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Ekzistojnë shumë teori për mënyrën se si u shfaq sanskritishtja. Një prej tyre ka të bëjë me një migrim të arianëve nga perëndimi në Indi ku ata sollën me vete gjuhën e tyre. Sanskritishtja është gjuhë e lashtë dhe mund të krahasohet me latinishten e cila flitet në Evropë. Libri më i vjetër i njohur në botë është shkruar në gjuhën sanskritishte. Pas shkrimit të Upanishadeve, gjuha sanskritishte u zhduk gradualisht për shkak të hierarkisë. Sanskritishtja është një gjuhë mjaft komplekse dhe e pasur, që ka shërbyer si burimi i mjaft gjuhëve moderne indiane, ashtu si latinishtja njihet si burimi i gjuhëve evropiane të tilla, si: frëngjishtja e spanjishtja.
mt: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came to be. One of them has to do with an Aryan migration from the west to India where they brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and can be compared to Latin which is spoken in Europe. The oldest book known in the world is written in Sanskrit. After the writing of the Upanishads, the Sanskrit language gradually died out due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served as the source of many modern Indian languages, as well as Latin is known as the source of European languages such as: French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Si do të më tërhiqte forca e rëndesës e Iosë? Nëse do të qëndronit mbi sipërfaqen e Iosë, do të peshonit më pak se në Tokë. Një person që peshon 200 paundë (90 kg) në Tokë do të peshonte rreth 36 paundë (16 kg) ne lo. Prandaj, forca e rëndesës të tërheq natyrisht më pak.
mt: How would Ios's gravity pull you? If you were to stay on Ios, you would weigh less than on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on Ios. So, the force of gravity would pull you less naturally.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Sipërfaqja e Hënës përbëhet nga gurët dhe pluhuri. Shtresa e jashtme e Hënës quhet kore. Korja është rreth 70 km e trashë në anën e dukshme dhe 100 km e trashë në anën e padukshme të hënës. Ajo është më e hollë nën zonat e errëta maria dhe më e trashë nën zonat malore. Mund të ekzistojnë më shumë dete në anën e afërt, sepse korja është më e hollë. Lava e kishte më të lehtë të ngrihej deri në sipërfaqe.
mt: The surface of the Moon is covered by rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the visible side and 100 km thick on the dark side of the Moon. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the mountains. There may be more seas on the near side, since the crust is thinner. Lava had an easier time rising to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Shumë persona ëndërrojnë ditën kur njerëzit do të mund të udhëtojnë drejt një ylli tjetër dhe do të eksplorojnë botë të tjera. Disa njerëz pyesin veten se çfarë ka atje jashtë, disa mendojnë se në një planet tjetër mund të jetojnë jashtëtokësorët ose një formë tjetër jete. Megjithatë në qoftë se kjo do të ndodhë ndonjëherë, ka gjasa të mos ndodhë për një periudhë mjaft të gjatë. Yjet janë aq të shpërndarë sa distanca midis yjeve ""fqinjë"" është triliona milje. Ndoshta një ditë, nipërit dhe mbesat tuaja do ta gjejnë veten në një botë aliene duke u menduar për paraardhësit e lashtë?"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when people will be able to travel to another star and explore other worlds. Some people wonder what is out there, some think that on another planet there are aliens or some other form of life. However, if this will ever happen, it is likely to not happen for a very long time. Stars are so spread out that the distance between "neighboring" stars is trillions of miles. Maybe one day, your grandchildren will find themselves in an alien world thinking about their ancient ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Dielli nuk ka kore si Toka, mbi të cilën mund të qëndrohet. Dielli përbëhet i gjithi nga gaze, zjarri dhe plazma. Gazi bëhet më i rrallë kur largohesh prej qendrës së Diellit. Ana e jashtme e Diellit që ne vështrojmë quhet fotosferë, që do të thotë ""top drite""."
mt: "The Sun has no core like the Earth, on which it can stand. The Sun is made entirely of gas, fire and plasma. Gas becomes rarer as you move away from the Sun's center. The outer surface of the Sun that we see is called the photosphere, which means "top of light.""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: "Dielli nuk ka kore si Toka, mbi të cilën mund të qëndrohet. Dielli përbëhet i gjithi nga gaze, zjarri dhe plazma. Gazi bëhet më i rrallë kur largohesh prej qendrës së Diellit. Ana e jashtme e Diellit që ne vështrojmë quhet fotosferë, që do të thotë ""top drite""."

src: Afërsisht tre mijë vite më pas, në vitin 1610, astronomi italian Galileo Galilei përdori një teleskop për të vrojtuar që Afërdita ka faza, njëlloj si hëna. Fazat ndodhin për arsye se ndriçohet vetëm ana e Venusit (apo e Hënës) që është e drejtuar nga Dielli. Fazat e Venusit ndihmonin teorinë e Kopernikut që planetët rrotullohen përreth Diellit. Disa vite më pas, në 1639-ën-, një astronom anglez i quajtur Jeremia Horroks vuri re një kalim të Venusit.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just like the moon. The phases happen because only one side of Venus (or the moon) is lit by the sun. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the sun. A few years later, in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks noticed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Afërsisht tre mijë vite më pas, në vitin 1610, astronomi italian Galileo Galilei përdori një teleskop për të vrojtuar që Afërdita ka faza, njëlloj si hëna. Fazat ndodhin për arsye se ndriçohet vetëm ana e Venusit (apo e Hënës) që është e drejtuar nga Dielli. Fazat e Venusit ndihmonin teorinë e Kopernikut që planetët rrotullohen përreth Diellit. Disa vite më pas, në 1639-ën-, një astronom anglez i quajtur Jeremia Horroks vuri re një kalim të Venusit.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just like the moon. The phases happen because only one side of Venus (or the moon) is lit by the sun. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the sun. A few years later, in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks noticed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Lumi i Amazonës është lumi i dytë në Tokë për nga gjatësia dhe i pari për nga gjerësia. Në të qarkullon 8 herë më shumë ujë se në lumin që renditet i dyti. Amazona është po ashtu lumi më i gjerë në tokë, me gjerësi gjashtë milje në disa raste. Plot 20 për qind e ujit që derdhet nga lumenjtë e planetit në oqeane vjen nga Amazona. Lumi kryesor, Amazona, është 6387 km (3980 milje). Ai mbledh ujin e mijëra lumenjve më të vegjël.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river in the world and the largest by volume. It is also one of the rivers with the most water discharge. Amazon is also the widest river in the world, with a width of six miles in some places. About 20 percent of the water that flows into the world's oceans comes from the Amazon. The main river, the Amazon, is 6387 km (3980 miles). It collects the water of thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
